feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Integration Suite
feed.subtitle: SAP Integration Suite Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Error eDocument Cockpit
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I hope you are doing very well. Today I have a question regarding an Electronic Invoicing integration that I am developing. I have S4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION, Integration Suite as middleware, and EFACT as the electronic invoicing provider. What happens is that from S4 an XML is generated that will be sent to EFACT, but before sending it I need to transform the XML into the structure they expect and then send it to them in a file. This part is not the issue, I just mention it to give context.

The problem is that when I trigger the process from the eDocument Cockpit, I get these errors. However, if I check in Integration Suite, it shows as completed and I can see the response returned by the electronic provider. Has any of you experts experienced a similar situation?

Regards.

entry.title: JIRA to SAP CALM via SAP Integration Suite
entry.content: We are planning to establish an integration between Jira and SAP Cloud ALM using the SAP Integration Suite. Kindly provide the detailed connection setup and configuration guide, including any prerequisites, authentication methods, message mapping, and error handling best practices necessary for a seamless data exchange.

entry.title: Event Mesh activation not possible in Integration Suite - free plan
entry.content:
Hello!

I am trying to set up the Manage Business Events Capability in Integration Suite - free plan

I am able to activate the capability, but when trying to activate Event Mesh (Configure -> Event Mesh) I get a message that it was set up ok but the Event Mesh shows the "failed" sign. In the queues it shows "Event mesh activation failed. Please try again."

I found note 0003527095 which references this error, but the suggested solution "To resolve this issue, the Event Mesh default plan must be removed from the subaccount." does not apply here, I have not added the Event Mesh default plan to the sub-account and still get the error.

I am wondering if the Event Mesh can even be used from the Integration Suite - free plan (I am using a PAYG global account with only the Integration Suite - free added for the subaccount).

Any help would be greatly appreciated, thanks!

entry.title: Download iFlow with integration content API without merging configured values with defaults
entry.content:
I'm using this API: https://api.sap.com/api/IntegrationContent/overview

When i call /IntegrationDesigntimeArtifacts(Id='{Id}',Version='{Version}')/$value the API seems to merge the configured values with the default values. Is it possible to get the integration flow with just the default values?

When I try to download an integration flow by using the regular UI, both options are available:

entry.title: ServiceKey grant permissions to only specific iflows ?
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

I have a general question regarding the SAP Integration Suite.

Currently, we generate a ServiceKey to allow HTTP access to our iFlows from outside. Is there a way to restrict HTTP access using the ServiceKey to only specific iFlows?

As we understand it, a single ServiceKey currently grants access to all endpoints, which can be a security concern. Are there any best practices or configuration options to limit access for a ServiceKey to specific iFlows only? Thank you very much in advance for your support!

entry.title: SAP CPI: Retrieve Iflow unique id(reg_id) via IFlow (workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages)
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

There is an internal (unofficial) API for SAP CPI artifacts. 

 

https://<your-host>.hana.ondemand.com/odata/1.0/workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages('<your-package>')/Artifacts?&$format=json

In comparison to the official API, it for packages it will give you an internal ID of an Iflow (reg_id). 
In browser, once one is logged into CPI, entering the URL will respond with JSON data back. 
But how to execute that in an automated Iflow?
I already tried to create OAuth2 (Code) credentials, read the Token via script and authenticate via Header. It did not work. 
Any hint, example is more than welcome.

thank you & kind regards | Simon

entry.title: Principal propagation in sap CPI to ECC
entry.content:
HI Members,

Hope you are doing well.

i have scenario as external system is sending data to SAP CPI from there it should reach to ECC via Cloud connector and do the transaction with same user as external system sent. where external system is using basic authentication and message is reaching to sap CPI but when request is going to ECC it giving error as "no identity configured for the user" . same user existed in sap ecc but its failing even we used the principal propagation setup in ECC and cert mapping in ECC.

 Can you please help me with details to do the principal propagation in SAP CPI to ECC .

Thanks & Regards

Madhu

entry.title: SAP BTP Integration Suite learning exercise
entry.content:
Hi,

I am getting below error while trying to access https://sapes5.sapdevcenter.com/sap/opu/odata/iwbep/GWSAMPLE_BASIC/ProductSet(HT-1000) from the SAP BTP Integration Suite learning exercise.

 

<SAP_Transaction>For backend administrators: use ADT feed reader "SAP Gateway Error Log" or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details</SAP_Transaction>
<SAP_Note>See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis (https://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1797736)</SAP_Note>
 
And If I try to access the link from SAP_Note --> https://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1797736
I am getting below message -
 
No data
Unable to fetch data at the moment. This might be due to a server error or a network issue. Please try again later.
 
Please let me know how to resolve this.

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite - SMB (Server message block) adapter - error STATUS_BAD_NETWORK_NAME
entry.content:
#SAP #IntegrationSuite #SMB #ServerMessageBlock #STATUS_BAD_NETWORK_NAME 

SAP has recently launched a new version of SMB adapter that allows to connect to a on-premise fileshare using cloud connector. Note 3546814 -> Configure the SMB Sender Adapter | SAP Help Portal

Using the SAP help documentation, I am trying to use SMB adapter to connect to a Network fileshare in our On-premise network, via cloud connector.

I have configured the TCP connection to the FileShare server in Cloud connector, and configured the SMB sender adapter in the iFlow, however, I am getting the error :  STATUS_BAD_NETWORK_NAME 

I can open the same fileshare in the browser and it displays all the folders under that:

The TCP connection in cloud connector :

The SMB adapter configuration in the iFlow

(Z_NETAPP is a credential to the fileshare that I have created in Security Material in integration suite)

I have tried several changes in the SMB adapter connection and processing sections, but I am still getting the same issue everytime.

Since this is a new adapter (version) by SAP, I could not find much content in the SAP community search.

If anyone has used this adapter in any integration scenario, please suggest a solution to fix this problem.

 

Regards,

Bharat Bajaj

 

@finny_babu 

@ShilpaVij 

@UdoPaltzer

entry.title: Error in an SAP Integration Suite integration
entry.content:
Hello, good afternoon.
We encountered an error when trying to run an integration included in the Mexico Document Compliance Generic package. The problem is that when we add an example XML with fictitious values, we don"t have a PAC configured yet and want to simulate a response and test these integrations.
The error is in the mapping between the input XML and the configured XSD.
The error is the following: com.sap.aii.mappingtool.tf7.IllegalInstanceException: Cannot produce target element /ns3:PACResponse. Queue has not enough values ​​in context. Target XSD requires a value for this element, but target field mapping does not produce one. Probably the XML-instance is not valid for the source XSD, or the target field mapping does not meet the requirement of the target XSD. on the exchange: Exchange[03B9D4CF234F9BE-0000000000000003]

Thank you very much for the support

Regards, Christopher Rivas

entry.title: How to Send Custom Headers (e.g., Transaction-Id) in HTTP PATCH Request from SAP CPI
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am working on an integration in SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI) where I need to make an HTTP PATCH request and send custom headers such as Transaction-Id, Content-Type, Accept, and Authorization.

I tried to set the headers as a single string like this: Transaction-Id|Content-Type|Accept|Authorization

And also I tried to define in a content modifier and groovy, but it did not work.

Could someone please advise on the correct way to set and send multiple custom headers in a PATCH request from CPI?
Is there a recommended approach using Groovy scripts or Content Modifiers to ensure all headers are included in the outbound HTTP call?

Any examples or best practices would be greatly appreciated!

Note: With POST worked

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: EDA with AEM and SAP Customer Activity Repository
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

we’re currently expanding our Event-Driven Architecture using SAP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) to connect more systems and data products.

Most integrations follow a standardized approach, which helps us keep things maintainable. One system we’re now looking at is SAP Customer Activity Repository (CAR) – especially for event-based use cases like promotions and coupons.

We’ve explored several options, but none of them seem to fit well into a clean, standard setup:

  • AIF for AEM doesn’t run on CAR due to missing S/4HANA core components.
  • ASAPIO isn’t supported on CAR.
  • SLT from CAR to S/4HANA to use AIF or ASAPIO there feels like a detour.
  • Custom BAPI-based REST calls are possible, but not really what we’re aiming for.

So here’s the question:

Is there a standard or recommended way to bring SAP CAR into an event-driven architecture—without relying on custom developments or indirect replication paths?

Would love to hear how others have approached this!

entry.title: Looking for Payload Structure for AI Adapter's with Request Payload Source as Exchange Body
entry.content:
Unable to successfully pass the configuration payload to the AI Core Orchestration service, resulting in a persistent HTTP 400 Bad Request. 

Passing the Payload via Content Modifier in the previous step before the AI Adapter Call 

Endpoint Used: https://xxxx.hana.ondemand.com/v2/inference/deployments/<deployment_id>/completion 

require confirmation of the exact, mandatory JSON payload structure (including all required keys, nesting, and data types) for Orchestration- completion.

Message Protocol :AICore-GenAIHub

Operation: Orchestration  - completion

Request Payload Source : Exchange Body

Expecting a Payload Structure something like this or steps to achieve this?

{
"orchestration_config": {
"module_configurations": {
"llm_module_config": {
"model_name": "gemini-2.5-flash"
},
"templating_module_config": {
"template": "incident-categorization" (Create it in Prompt Editor)
}
}
},
"input_params": {
"taxComplianceCheck": false,
"fraudRiskScore": 0.7
}
}

entry.title: How to Use Parameters and Imported Archives in SAP CPI Message Mapping
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently working on a message mapping in SAP CPI and I'm not sure how to use the Parameter tab in the mapping editor. I understand it's meant for passing external values into the mapping, but I’m unclear on how it behaves at runtime or how to bind it properly from the iFlow.

Also, I’d love to understand how Imported Archives work in this context. Can we use custom Java functions from these archives inside user-defined functions (UDFs)? If so, what are the best practices for organizing and referencing them?

Any examples or insights from your experience would be really helpful. Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Difficulty Triggering Workflow in SuccessFactors When Data Is Auto-Posted from BTP
entry.content:
Hi All,

I’m working on an integration where contract end data is auto-posted from SAP BTP to SuccessFactors (SF) . The data is being posted into the Resignation portlet, and I want to trigger a workflow in SF when this happens. But, the workflow is not getting triggered when the data is posted from BTP. 

Thanks,
Sakshi

entry.title: Multiple Timer - Schedule in one IFlow
entry.content:
Hi, Is it possible to add multiple schedule for a timer to run twice a day with a specific time in one IFlow?

Example:
I wanted to schedule this IFlow to run twice a day every 4:45AM and 2PM. 

This current IFlow is still using Timer version 1.0


or by using the new Timer version 1.4 - can this be achievable?

Thanks in advance!
